name: Hotel Novotel Le Mans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We broke our journey here on the way to and from Pau. Clean, comfortable rooms were perfectly adequate for an overnight stop, and quiet (the room was air conditioned but we chose instead to sleep with the window wide open, and had no traffic noise). Enjoyed a good meal in the room.
reviews.title: Great stop over for SW France

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at around 9pm having driven from St Malo and were going on to Germany the next day. Although some other reviewers have commented that finding this hotel can be difficult our sat-nav took us straight there. Check-in was smooth and the restaurant still open although the prices of food and drink reflect the captive market they have got and you do not go to a Novotel for gourmet cuisine. The room was standard Novotel - clean with a comfortable bed and perfectly good for a night or two. The hotel is obviously popular with Le Mans enthusiasts and assume there must have been a open day being held because I counted 12 other Porsches in the car park in addition to mine.
reviews.title: Perfectly good for an overnight stop

reviews.text: thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Novotel Le Mans.
reviews.title: Novotel Le Mans
our stay
reviews.text: From the moment of arrival, the ease of access from the motorway through pleasant residential areas, the friendly and helpful staff, the comfort and practicality of accommodation, to the excellent dining and choice of menus including abundant healthy choices, and the wonderful buffet breakfast, everything about Novotel is geared to the needs of the tired long-distance traveller.

reviews.title: The usual high Novotel standard
reviews.text: And the biggest bonus is the secure parking and street level parking, ideal for a motorcyclist like myself.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A reasonable hotel for a one night stop over. Reception fine and friendly. Restaurant closed and limited to a small lobby area. Breakfast very expensive and sparse., Never again. This hotel has seen better days.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.text: agree with previous reviewers - this is the perfect family stopover, it has everything - easy free parking (which most city Novotels don't have in our experience), lots of space for kids to run around, relaxed restaurant (try the sharing meals, lovely roast chicken and free extra chips brought with a smile so our friends could snack!), breakfast not too busy, and a spacious rural feel. Its very good value taking that all into account, its cheaper than other stopover Novotels presumably because its a bit out of town. Usual preponderence of GB plates in the car park (we Brits seem to love the Novotels). The old Plantagenet City in Le Mans worth a visit for a morning if you have time.
reviews.title: great stopover

reviews.text: Perfect hotel for family stopover whilst driving through France. Set up well to cope with travel weary children - small pool, indoor & outdoor pay areas and free kids pack. Breakfast was perfect to set you on your way and just right distance from motorway to be away from it but quickly back on it in the morning.
reviews.title: Great stopover

reviews.text: We stayed here to break our trip from Bordeaux to Calais; it seems a lot of people were doing the same thing. The hotel was absolutely fine - a typical Novotel really.
reviews.title: Nice overnight stay

reviews.text: Mohammed on reception was very friendly and helpful with directions and information. The room was comfortable and clean and the air-con worked really well. The hotel is on the outskirts of the town center however there is a tram stop right outside that gets you into the center (stop Republique) in about 10-15 minutes and runs every 10 minutes or so - it costs about 3 Euros for a return. (At the Republique stop there are many restaurants and bistros to choose from) Breakfast at the hotel was varied and plentiful and costs about 14 euros if not on your room rate (however nobody checks you in or out of the restaurant so if you are "dishonest" you could deny having breakfast when you leave. I saw a number of people do this - tut tut.) The hotel has a games room for the kids which was a nice touch - there's also a pool and a playground area.
reviews.title: Great stop over

reviews.text: The television facilities in the room are basic for English speakers - just BBC World. No Pay Movies. However there is free WiFi so that was a plus.
reviews.title: Great hotel for stop over in france

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Le Mans Classic

aka: Novotel Le Mans Est Hotel Le Mans
description: The Novotel Le Mans Est is a 3 star hotel located 10 minutes from the centre of town. We offer 94 airconditioned rooms, a restaurant, a bar and five conference rooms for your meetings and seminars for up to 210 people. This luxury hotel is equally suitable for a business trip or a holiday in Le Mans with your partner or family. Guests also enjoy the convenience of a private car park, a swimming pool and a unique green area nearby.
